title: Streamline upwind Petrov–Galerkin pressure-stabilizing Petrov–Galerkin formulation for incompressible Navier–Stokes equations
summary: The streamline upwind Petrov–Galerkin pressure-stabilizing Petrov–Galerkin formulation for incompressible Navier–Stokes equations can be used for finite element computations of high Reynolds number incompressible flow using equal order of finite element space (i.e. P k − P k {\displaystyle \mathbb {P} _{k}-\mathbb {P} _{k}} ) by introducing additional stabilization terms in the Navier–Stokes Galerkin formulation.[1][2]
